page.title: 18HOUSING IN PENLAN, SWANSEA
page.content: Nearly all the houses in Penlan were Council-built in the early 1950s. It is part of a large, sprawling estate with few amenities in it. Houses are a mixture of brick-built, steel and highrise flats. By now, many are in need of repair. Many houses are having new roofs fitted. Lots of the steel houses are being rebuilt. Some have been demolished and replaced by large brick houses. Opposite these is new 'sheltered accommodation' for old people who live in nice maisonettes. Unfortunately, many children play there and frighten the old people. Over the last 5 years, all young children have been moved out of the highrise flats and as a result our school has lost more than half its children. Sadly, one of our boys fell off scaffolding around one of these buildings and was killed.
